title: Citi Hires Christy Wyatt to Lead Global Consumer eBusiness and Mobile Technology Unit
summary: New York - Citigroup today announced that Christy Wyatt will join the company's Global Consumer Technology team on August 1 as Global Head of Consumer eBusiness and Mobile Technology.
tag-1: Citi Hires Christy Wyatt to Lead Global Consumer eBusiness and Mobile Technology Unit
tag-2: New York – Citigroup today announced that Christy Wyatt will join the company's Global Consumer Technology team on August 1 as Global Head of Consumer eBusiness and Mobile Technology.
tag-3: Wyatt, who served most recently as Senior Vice President and General Manager for Motorola Mobility's Enterprise Business Unit, will lead the technology teams responsible for leading-edge, high-volume, consumer-facing applications for the Internet, mobile and ATM channels for all of Citi's consumer banking businesses globally.
tag-4: "Christy's 16 years of experience in the mobile technology industry and her client focus will be invaluable at Citi as we work to create the world's premier digital bank with the best customer experience across all channels and products," said Mark Torkos, Citi's Chief Information Officer for Global Consumer Banking. "The world may be diverging in many ways, but Citi's role is to make connections and put our financial strength and ingenuity to work for our clients. Christy and her team will build on the capabilities and conveniences we're offering in every country where our consumer bank operates."
tag-5: Wyatt's prior roles included software and services product management at Motorola, Director of Worldwide Developer Relations at Apple Inc., and key development, licensing, sales and business development roles at Palm Inc., Sun Microsystems, JavaSoft and ESRI.
tag-6: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
